title: Justin Bieber opens up on Twitch about the pain of staying vulnerable in fame

He shared that despite numerous positive comments, a single negative remark can deeply affect him, often stemming from others' insecurities. Bieber emphasized that putting himself out there authentically is challenging, even for a global star, highlighting the human side of fame.

title: Study in the UK: Autumn timelines decoded; why Indian students must start early
description: The United Kingdom continues to be a preferred destination for Indian students, especially for the Autumn Intake that starts each September or October. However, most applicants underestimate how early they must begin. By March, competitive courses begin reviewing applications, and by April, most scholarships close. Starting early—shortlisting, preparing statements, gathering references, and completing visa formalities—helps avoid the last-minute rush that often derails otherwise strong profiles.

title: Sheikh Hasina reveals why she fled Bangladesh; calls August protests an 'insurrection'
description: Ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, speaking from exile, defended her departure from Bangladesh as a necessity for safety. Hasina dismissed the International Crimes Tribunal proceedings against her as a politically motivated 'sham trial.'

title: Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences: Born out of a crisis, built to redefine care
description: Conceived in the shadow of COVID-19, the Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) was envisioned as a long-term response to the vulnerabilities that the pandemic exposed in the public healthcare system. Now nearing completion, the ₹1,070-crore, 1,000-bed TIMS facility at Sanathnagar in Hyderabad represents the State’s biggest leap toward an autonomous, next-gen government hospital model. As its opening draws near, Siddharth Kumar Singh examines whether it would live up to that promise or end up as a missed opportunity

title: Defying Trump's US manufacturing push? Ford returns to India with Rs 3,250 cr plan
description: Ford Motor Company is set to restart manufacturing in India. The automaker will invest Rs 3,250 crore in its Chennai facility. This move marks a significant return after exiting vehicle production in 2021. The plant will focus on engine manufacturing for export. Production is scheduled to begin in 2029. This project is expected to create over 600 jobs.

description: In a remarkable feat of medical innovation, doctors in New Delhi have successfully reconstructed a young accident victim's thumb using his own second toe. The patient, who lost his leg and thumb in a severe road accident, underwent a complex microsurgical procedure.

description: A rare interstellar visitor, comet 3I/ATLAS, is currently traversing our solar system, offering scientists a unique chance to study an object from another star.  This comet, unlike those orbiting our Sun, follows a one-time hyperbolic path.  Best viewing opportunities are in the eastern predawn sky mid-to-late November 2025, requiring at least an eight-inch telescope.

The swift action by Counter Intelligence and local police underscores a commitment to national security and peace within the state.

description: A 42-year-old chef's battle with aggressive male breast cancer, a rare but serious condition, underscores the importance of vigilance. Despite initial dismissal of a chest lump, his diagnosis highlights that men are not immune. Early detection is crucial, as symptoms like lumps or nipple changes can be easily overlooked.

title: World’s first white Iberian lynx captured on camera in Spain’s wild mountains
description: A rare white Iberian lynx, believed to be the first leucistic of its kind, has been spotted in Spain, a testament to successful conservation efforts. Its sighting underscores the importance of ongoing protection for this vulnerable predator.
